title: Enhancing Customer Service Practical Competencies: Advanced Learning Mechanics of Indoor Rock Climbing through an Ecological Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Basic rock climbing techniques (handhold/foothold use, balance maintenance) and mathematical spatial reasoning ability
context.additional_context: Customer service competency enhancement program for service/customer-facing role practitioners

learning_goals: Learners can apply three or more variations of body composition patterns (arm-leg coordination, weight distribution) at various angles (0°–90°) during indoor rock climbing.

Learners expand their existing movement repertoires through an ecological dynamics approach and establish problem-solving strategies with over 80% success in new environments (virtual rock structures).

Learners can analyze physical variables (friction, distance between support points) occurring during climbing through mathematical modeling (ratio/angle calculations) to derive optimal movement paths.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
